gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc
Class JdbcCustomAnswerSingleStatementQuestion<A>

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractBaseWorker
      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.workers.AbstractResourceConsumer
          gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.AbstractJdbcWorker
              gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.JdbcQuestion<A>
                  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.JdbcSingleStatementQuestion<A>
                      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.jdbc.JdbcCustomAnswerSingleStatementQuestion<A>
Type Parameters:
A - Answer type
All Implemented Interfaces:
NamedFieldsContainer, OrderedFieldsContainer, Question<A>, Worker
public abstract class JdbcCustomAnswerSingleStatementQuestion<A>
extends JdbcSingleStatementQuestion<A>
implements OrderedFieldsContainer, NamedFieldsContainer

Question implementation used in cases where:

  • Only one SQL statement is required.
  • The returned type cannot be retrieved from a single column with the JDBC api and needs to be constructed by the values taken from one or more columns.

    The implementor has to implement createAnswer() to construct the answer.

    Constructor Detail

    JdbcCustomAnswerSingleStatementQuestion

    public JdbcCustomAnswerSingleStatementQuestion()
    Method Detail

    createAnswer

    protected abstract A createAnswer()
                           throws DataAccessException
    Extension point that allows the developer to create the A instance that will encapsulate the answer and extract data from the ResultSet rs to populate it with.
    This will only execute if the result set has at least one row. If no rows are returned the answer will be null. It is the responsibility of the implementor to handle this (e.g. by overriding getAnswer()) or document it.

    Returns:
    the created answer
    Throws:
    DataAccessException

             throws DataException,
